name: insipidness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of not having a strong taste or character, or of lacking interest or energy: She delivers an admirable performance, despite the film's insipidness. Luckily, the heart of the story was not dumbed down to insipidness. See
insipid
More examplesFewer examplesThe Cornish pasty pales into insipidness next to the Indian samosa.The insipidness of the beers was attributed to a low malt content.I was looking for songs that would engage my daughter without the insipidness that comes with much children's music.
